channel.title: 28 Weeks Later
channel.description:
Yesterday, I rented the movie of 28 Weeks Later. If your asking why I didn't see it in the theaters my answer is this: Screw it. Too many dipshits being assholes so you can't hear whats going on.
All in all, it was a great movie. If you have not seen it, and you like horror stuff, I would recommend it to you.
[b][i][u]SPOILER BELOW[/u][/i][/b] [size=4pt]It goes like this. There is a disease called 'Rage' that goes around an makes people into zombie-like things. They go around biting people and killing them and making them infected. 28 weeks later, the last of the people with 'Rage' die out, and the non-infected people decide to build a new city and let people in slowly. There are 2 kids that arrive into the city, meet there dad and find out how their mother died. So, they want to be dopey and go to the place where the military don't let them go. They find their mother, not attacking them, but with 'Rage' in her. The military come in and get the mother into a place to maybe try to find a cure, and the children get put into a cell-like place so they don't escape again. The father comes in and the children start yelling that they want to see their mother. So the father becomes a dopey idiot and goes into the place where their mother is kept in and starts to kiss his wife.(NOTE, RAGE GETS TRANSFERED FROM ONE PERSON TO ANOTHER FROM BITING THEM OR THE PERSONS SALIVA)He gets infected with rage, kills his wife, and goes killing guards.................can't be bothered to type the rest...anyway, it ends up the 2 kids are the only ones alive (and a few military people) at the end. ALL THE KIDS FAULT.[/size]

item.title: 28 Weeks Later
item.dc:creator: @nicodk nicodk
item.description:
@nicodk wrote:

I LOVED it. got it right here on my pc.

10/10 to both of them.
and unless the rumor is falst there will be a no 3.

taken from wikipedia

Sequel
“Well, I didn’t want to do the second one, because I was involved in “Sunshine.” But I went out and I helped them [with 28 Weeks Later]. I did some second-unit shooting on it. And I really enjoyed it, actually. There’s something about doing something trashy that’s great. Where basically you just come in the door and you just kill them. That was rather refreshing.”
— Danny Boyle on directing.[33]

In March 2007, Boyle announced plans to create a “third chapter” of the film franchise, which may be given the title 28 Months Later with a 2009 release date,[34] thus creating a trilogy. Boyle has stated that his thoughts are to set the movie in Russia.[35]

In June 2007, it was announced that if DVD sales of the film did well Fox Atomic would consider producing the third film.[36]

In July 2007, while promoting the film Sunshine, Boyle revealed that he has a story formulating for the next film “There is an idea for the next one, something which would move [the story] on. I’ve got to think about it, whether it’s right or not.” Boyle also revealed that he would return as the director.[37]

Read full topic

item.title: 28 Weeks Later
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:6, topic:168767”]Yes… but who says they’ll run out of food this time? They could eat eachother or get smarter.

28 months later will inevitably be like south america fighting back the disease as they are the ones furthest away from the disease (land wise, not distance).

Maybe itll be like I Am Legend and someone finds a cure and they are trying to vaccinate and start again. Then another outbreak happens and everyone dies? Or the disease becomes airborne and its crazy shit.[/quote]

Haha that made me laugh. That’s why I said it wouldn’t be easy to direct, it’d have to be complex as fuck.

Read full topic

item.title: 28 Weeks Later
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Screw it. Too many dipshits being assholes so you can't hear whats going on.

Where the hell do you live? That’s the rarest of occasions happens in Scotland, thank fuck.

I did like this movie, although I liked 28 Days Later equally, since that had a hint of mysteriousness… davidude36, I hope 28 Months Later comes too. That would be hard to direct though, by then wouldn’t the whole of Europe, Africa and Asia be consumed by the disease? Right enough, they do die of starvation after what 25 weeks or something?

item.title: 28 Weeks Later
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I loved it all so much, (from 28 days to 28 weeks i mean).
The beginning of 28 weeks later was so emotional, and that music just sets the scene for what is happening so well.

I am praying they make “28 months later”

Ratings:
28 days later - 9/10 (towards the end it became dragging and hard to tell what was going on)
28 weeks later 10/10 (everything a good movie needs in my opinion)

EDIT - by the way OWNER 2007 have you even seen 28 days later? (Just wondering because it sounds like you didn’t)

Read full topic
